metadata.title: CVE-2015-8553 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: Xen allows guest OS users to obtain sensitive information fromuninitialized locations in host OS kernel memory by not enabling memory andI/O decoding control bits.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2015-0777.

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
